name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(naphthalen-2-yl)-2-phenylethanimine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-897

name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(naphthalen-2-yl)-2-phenylethanimine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-897
Reason: The compound (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(naphthalen-2-yl)-2-phenylethanimine contains several functional groups that influence its melting point. The basic unit we could consider is naphthalene, which has a melting point of 80. The functional groups and structural features that will affect the melting point are: 1. Phenyl group - which generally increases the melting point due to the ability to stack well and increase the rigidity of the molecule (+20). 2. N-hydroxyimine group - introduces hydrogen bonding which would significantly raise the melting point (+40). 3. The ethanimine side chain - contributes slightly to the molecular weight and rigidity but has a lesser effect on the melting point (+10). Combining these effects gives us an estimated influence on the melting point.
Prediction: The predicted melting point of the compound would be approximately 80 (naphthalene) + 20 (phenyl) + 40 (N-hydroxyimine) + 10 (ethanimine side chain) = 150.

name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(naphthalen-2-yl)-2-phenylethanimine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-897
Reason: The compound (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(naphthalen-2-yl)-2-phenylethanimine contains several functional groups that affect its melting point, with naphthalene as the basic unit. The naphthalene base has a melting point of 80. The individual contributions of functional groups and structural features to the melting point would be: 1. Phenyl group - generally increases the melting point due to increased molecular rigidity and pi-pi interactions (+25). 2. N-hydroxyimine group - significantly elevates the melting point via hydrogen bonding and contribution to molecular rigidity (+20). 3. Ethanimine side chain - adds to the molecular weight and rigidity, with a smaller impact on the melting point (+4). All these effects combined give an estimated influence on the melting point when considering each group individually and their interactions.
Prediction: The predicted melting point of the compound would be approximately 80 (naphthalene) + 25 (phenyl) + 20 (N-hydroxyimine) + 4 (ethanimine side chain) = 129.
